verses.verse: False (Under this word he condemneth all false weights, measures and deceit.) balances are an abomination unto the Lord: but a perfect (Hebrew, stone.) weight pleaseth him.
When pride cometh, then cometh (When man so getteth himself, and thinketh to be exalted above his vocation, then God bringeth him to confusion.) shame: but with the lowly is wisdom.
The uprightness of the just shall guide them: but the frowardness of the transgressors shall destroy them.
(Cross references: : Ezek. 7:19) Riches avail not in the day of wrath: but righteousness delivereth from death.
The righteousness of the upright shall direct his way: but the wicked shall fall in his own wickedness.
The righteousness of the just shall deliver them: but the transgressors shall be taken in their own wickedness.
When a wicked man dieth, his hope perisheth, and the hope of the unjust shall perish.
The righteous escapeth out of trouble, and the wicked shall come in his (That is, shall enter into trouble.) stead.
An (A dissembler that pretendeth friendship, but is a privy enemy.) hypocrite with his mouth hurteth his neighbor: but the righteous shall be delivered by knowledge.

In the prosperity of the righteous the city (The country is blessed, where there are godly men, and they ought to rejoice when the wicked are taken away.) rejoiceth: and when the wicked perish, there is joy.
By the (Or, prosperity.) blessing of the righteous the city is exalted: but it is subverted by the mouth of the wicked.
He that despiseth his neighbor, is destitute of wisdom: but a man of understanding will (Will not make light report of others.) keep silence.
He that goeth about as a slanderer, discovereth a secret: but he that is of a faithful heart, concealeth a matter.
Where no counsel is, the people fall: but where many (Where God giveth store of men of wisdom and counsel: whose conversation he knoweth not.) counselors are, there is health.

He shall be sore vexed, that is surety for a (He that doeth not without judgment and consideration of the circumstances, puts himself in danger, as Prov. 6:1.) stranger, and he that hateth suretiship, is sure.
A (Or, modest.) gracious woman attaineth honor, and the strong men attain riches.
He that is merciful, (Is both good to himself and to others.) rewardeth his own soul: but he that troubleth his own (Or, neighbor.) flesh, is cruel.
The wicked worketh a deceitful work: but he that soweth righteousness, shall receive a sure reward.
As righteousness leadeth to life: so he that followeth evil, seeketh his own death.
They that are of a froward heart, are abomination to the Lord: but they that are upright in their way, are his delight.

(Though they make never so many friends, or think themselves never so sure, yet they shall not escape.) Though hand join in hand, the wicked shall not be unpunished: but the seed of the righteous shall escape.
As a jewel of gold in a swine’s snout: so is a fair woman which (Or, of uncomely behavior.) lacketh discretion.
The desire of the righteous is only good: but the hope of the wicked (They can look for nothing but God’s vengeance.) is indignation.
There is that scattereth, (Meaning them that give liberally, whom God blesseth.) and is more increased: but he that spareth more (That is, the niggard.) than is right, surely cometh to poverty.
The (Or, generous.) liberal person shall have plenty: and he that watereth, shall also have rain.
He that withdraweth the corn, the people will curse him: but blessing shall be upon the head of him that (That provideth for the use of them that are in necessity.) selleth corn.
He that seeketh good things getteth favor: but he that seeketh evil, it shall come to him.
He that trusteth in his riches, shall fall: but the righteous shall flourish as a leaf.

He that troubleth his own (The covetous men that spare their riches to the hindrance of their families, shall be deprived thereof miserably.) house, shall inherit the wind, and the fool shall be (For though the wicked be rich, yet are they but slaves to the godly, which are the true possessors of the gifts of God.) servant to the wise in heart.
The fruit of the righteous is as a tree of life, and he that (That is, bringeth them to the knowledge of God.) winneth souls is wise.
Behold, the righteous shall be (Shall be punished as he deserveth, 1 Pet. 4:18.) recompensed in the earth: how much more the wicked and the sinner?
